articles.title: 60th Anniversary of Rodong Sinmun Marked
Scientific Symposium on Reconstructed Kaesong Ryongthong Temple
articles.content:
Scientific Symposium on Reconstructed Kaesong Ryongthong Temple 
    Kaesong, October 31 (KCNA) -- A scientific symposium commemorating the reconstruction of Kaesong Ryongthong Temple was held on Oct. 31.
 Present at the symposium were Buddhists, scholars and experts in the field of historic and cultural relics in the north and the south and those related to Buddhism of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon). 
 Scholars of the north, south and Chongryon in their speeches proved on the basis of excavatory data and historic records that the temple is a holy place of Buddhism in Korea. They spoke of the significance of the reconstruction of the temple.    
 They called upon scholars and Buddhists in the north, south and overseas to positively contribute to achieving national reunification and national unity and cooperation under the banner of the historic June 15 joint declaration.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from Swiss Guest
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Swiss Guest
    Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the chairman of the Swiss Novartis AG on a visit to the DPRK.
 It was handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, by Chairman Daniel Vasella today.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Il Sung
    Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung was presented with a gift by a delegation of the National Integrated Study and Research Centre of Nepal on a visit to the DPRK.
It was handed to an official concerned by its Chief Adviser Kamal Prasad Chaulagain who is heading the visiting delegation.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Swiss Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Swiss Delegation
    Pyongyang November 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today met and had a friendly conversation with the delegation of the Swiss Novartis AG led by Chairman Daniel Vasella at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.
 On hand were Minister of Public Health Kim Su Hak and officials concerned.
